stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.

stadium.name: The Sinking Field
stadium.description: A notoriously poorly-maintained stadium built on reclaimed marshland. The ground is unstable, often waterlogged, and sections of the stands are known to collapse.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Daring a teammate to eat a live worm.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Tapping each piece of their armor in a specific sequence.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è PLAYOFF FEVER: DO-OR-DIE AT THE HOLLOW MINE! üéôÔ∏è

Step right up and hold onto your hats, folks! This is Nok the Corrupter, your favorite demon of the airwaves, coming to you live from the wildflower-scented pits of The Hollow Mine! We‚Äôre in the thick of the Losers Bracket, Game 2 of a Best of 3 series, and the stakes are higher than the Watch Tower itself! My beloved Ebon Gate Corruptors are down one game to zero, and if they don't pull a win out of the mud today, their playoff dreams are going to be buried deeper than Lord Orzalon‚Äôs dignity! The atmosphere is electric‚Äîor maybe that's just the 'Humming Earth' under our feet making my teeth rattle! üèüÔ∏è‚ö°

The Wyrmwood Stronghammers have the home-field advantage today, and they‚Äôve emerged from that mine shaft looking like they‚Äôve been eating coal for breakfast! I spotted Godart Urissa earlier, and gee whiz, that oversized floppy hat is a real fashion statement‚Äîif you're a scarecrow! Meanwhile, over in the Corruptors' camp, Terle Chenay is leading a belching contest that‚Äôs loud enough to shatter the 'Tangled Vines' creeping up the stands! That‚Äôs the kind of team spirit I like to see‚Äîraw, gas-powered, and completely uncivilized! üëÉü™Æ

Keep an eye on the field, folks! Between the mine drafts blowing the ball off course and the strange energy buzzing in the dirt, this game is going to be a real corker! Bullion Iglesias was seen meditating in the corner‚Äîprobably dreaming of all the heads he‚Äôs going to crack today! So, grab your snacks and a sturdy shield, because the playoff action is about to explode! Let‚Äôs see if the Corruptors can force a Game 3 or if the Stronghammers are going to hammer the final nail in the coffin! üõ°Ô∏èü¶¥
postGame:
# üèüÔ∏è POST-GAME WRAP-UP: THE STRONGHAMMERS SEAL THE DEAL! üèüÔ∏è

Great shades of the Abyss, what a heart-wrenching, bone-snapping conclusion to this series! The Ebon Gate Corruptors fought like cornered hell-hounds, but in the end, the Wyrmwood Stronghammers defended their turf with a 3-2 victory, sweeping the series two games to zero! I haven't seen this much disappointment since Morgwae tried to convince me that 'literacy' was a valuable skill! The Hollow Mine was buzzing, the fans were screaming, and the mud was flying in every direction! üèüÔ∏èüå™Ô∏è

The game kicked off with a flurry of motion as Calvinna Isador snatched the troll head in the center field. She dodged through the defenses like she was skipping through one of those tea parties Maple likes to host! Before our boys could even get a grip on their sickles, the Stronghammers were on the move! Sabian Gleason, who spent his morning counting clouds, clearly had his eyes on the prize this afternoon, taking a long shot from the Away Field and nailing it for two points! Talk about a cold start for the Corruptors! üéØüí•

But the violence, oh the beautiful violence, was just getting started! Autumn Jodoin, fueled by raw eggs and determination, absolutely leveled Smith Syst with a tackle that sounded like a falling tree! Poor Smith was carted off early, and my heart just sank! Our Corruptors tried to regain some ground, but the defense was as thick as the ivy on the Watch Tower. Napoleon Anzovin finally showed some life, charging through the mud to set up a play that saw Bullion Iglesias dunk the ball into the goal! 1-2, and we were back in business, folks! üèÄü©∏

Halftime came and went, with the healers working overtime to patch up the wounded. The second half turned into a real slugfest! As Utter, the man who insists on being the last one out of the locker room, decided to make his presence felt! He lunged at Ultun Barthelemy with a tackle so fierce it sent the Stronghammer straight to the infirmary! It was a masterpiece of brutality that would make Sir Tanos weep into his cursed sword! ‚öîÔ∏èü¶¥

Napoleon Anzovin wasn't done yet, either! He took his kirkhammer and absolutely flattened Autumn Jodoin in retaliation! The crowd went wild, or maybe they were just vibrating from the Humming Earth! Either way, the momentum felt like it was shifting! The Stronghammers were looking rattled, and the mine drafts were blowing favor toward the Ebon Gate! üìâüë∫

However, the Stronghammers have a knack for being pests! Just when we thought we had them cornered, Calvinna Isador found a gap in the line! She sprinted into the end zone and dunked that troll head like she was putting a letter in a mailbox‚Äîonly much more violent and satisfying! That put Wyrmwood up 3-1, and the clock was ticking down faster than a demon's patience at a peace summit! ‚è≥üèÄ

As Utter managed to snag one more dunk late in the game to bring it to 3-2, but it was too little, too late! The Stronghammers' defense held firm in the closing minutes. We saw another round of injuries as Bullion Iglesias took out Sabian Gleason, but the score remained unchanged. The whistle blew, and the Ebon Gate Corruptors' season came to a muddy, miserable end! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ

What a performance by the home team, though it pains me to say it! Godart Urissa‚Äôs interception of Napoleon Anzovin‚Äôs wild pass at the end was the final dagger in the heart! I‚Äôm sure Count Trez Arrigo is celebrating somewhere, counting his gold and laughing at my misery! The Stronghammers move on, and the Corruptors go home to lick their wounds and maybe eat more worms for next season! ü™±üí∞

I must say, the 'Humming Earth' really seemed to mess with the Corruptors' passing game today. Smith Syst and Olnek Vizzone were dropping balls left and right! It‚Äôs hard to play catch when the ground is trying to shake your boots off! If only Sir Artorias had spent more time fixing the stadiums and less time being a celebrity, maybe we‚Äôd have a level playing field! But that's Trollball for you‚Äîunfair, bloody, and absolutely glorious! üèüÔ∏èüôå

So that‚Äôs it for this series! The Wyrmwood Stronghammers take it 2-0 and advance! To the Ebon Gate fans, keep your heads high‚Äîwe‚Äôll be back with more spikes and more spite next year! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most beautiful pit in Osterra! Don't let the sinkholes catch you on the way out! üéôÔ∏èüî•
